item.title: Lisa add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Live a good life. If there are gods and they are just, then they will not care how devout you have been, but will welcome you based on the virtues you have lived by. If there are gods, but unjust, then you should not want to worship them. If there are no gods, then you will be gone, but will have lived a noble life that will live on in the memories of your loved ones." -- Anonymous

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Vandana Shiva
item.description: "You are not Atlas carrying the world on your shoulder. It is good to remember that the planet is carrying you." -- Vandana Shiva

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Respond intelligently even to unintelligent treatment" -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "To know that you do not know is the best. To think you know when you do not is a disease. Recognizing this disease as a disease is to be free of it." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Lao-Tzu
item.description: "By letting go it all gets done." -- Lao-Tzu

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Returning violence for violence multiplies violence, adding deeper darkness to a night already devoid of stars... Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Everything was beautiful and nothing hurt." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "There is a time in every man's education when he arrives at the conviction that envy is ignorance; that imitation is suicide; that he must take himself for better, for worse, as his portion; that though the wide universe is full of good, no kernel of nourishing corn can come to him but through his toil bestowed on that plot of ground which is given to him to till. The power which resides in him is new in nature, and none but he knows what that is which he can do, nor does he know until he has tried." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Be silly. Be honest. Be kind." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Lisa add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride: I love you in this way because I do not know any other way of loving but this, in which there is no I or you, so intimate that your hand upon my chest is my hand, so intimate that when I fall asleep your eyes close." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Love is so short, forgetting is so long." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I want To do with you what spring does with the cherry trees." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Someday, somewhere - anywhere, unfailingly, you'll find yourself, and that, and only that, can be the happiest or bitterest hour of your life." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "Let us forget with generosity those who cannot love us" -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Perhaps all the dragons in our lives are princesses who are only waiting to see us act, just once, with beauty and courage. Perhaps everything that frightens us is, in its deepest essence, something helpless that wants our love." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Do not assume that he who seeks to comfort you now, lives untroubled among the simple and quiet words that sometimes do you good. His life may also have much sadness and difficulty, that remains far beyond yours. Were it otherwise, he would never have been able to find these words." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "Think... of the world you carry within you." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Most men lead lives of quiet desperation and go to the grave with the song still in them." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "There is no remedy for love, but to love more." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Lisa add a quote by henry david thoreau
item.description: "Things do not change; we change." -- henry david thoreau

item.title: Lisa add a quote by T.E. Lawrence
item.description: "All men dream: but not equally. Those who dream by night in the dusty recesses of their minds wake up in the day to find it was vanity, but the dreamers of the day are dangerous men, for they may act their dreams with open eyes, to make it possible." -- T.E. Lawrence

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Thich Nhat Hanh
item.description: "I promise myself that I will enjoy every minute of the day that is given me to live." -- Thich Nhat Hanh

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Thich Nhat Hanh
item.description: "The true miracle is not walking on water or walking in air, but simply walking on this earth." -- Thich Nhat Hanh

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Thich Nhat Hanh
item.description: "Peace is present right here and now, in ourselves and in everything we do and see. Every breath we take, every step we take, can be filled with peace, joy, and serenity. The question is whether or not we are in touch with it. We need only to be awake, alive in the present moment." -- Thich Nhat Hanh
